title-part.text: METHODS OR APPARATUS FOR STERILISING MATERIALS OR OBJECTS IN GENERAL
DISINFECTION, STERILISATION, OR DEODORISATION OF AIR
CHEMICAL ASPECTS OF BANDAGES, DRESSINGS, ABSORBENT PADS, OR SURGICAL ARTICLES
MATERIALS FOR BANDAGES, DRESSINGS, ABSORBENT PADS, OR SURGICAL ARTICLES

reference.text: preservation of bodies or disinfecting characterised by the agent employed A01N ; preserving, e.g. sterilising, food or foodstuffs A23 ; preparations for medical, dental or toilet purposes A61K ; preparation of ozone C01B13/10

note.note-paragraph:
The following IPC groups are not used in the CPC system. Subject matter covered by these groups is classified in the following CPC groups:
A61L33/10 covered by A61L33/0011
A61L33/14 covered by A61L33/0011
A61L33/16 covered by A61L33/0047
IPC7 groups A61L2/07 , A61L2/32 and subgroups, and A61L9/012 to A61L9/014 might be incomplete as relevant documents might still be classified in the hierarchical higher groups

title-part.text: Methods or apparatus for disinfecting or sterilising materials or objects other than foodstuffs or contact lenses

reference.text: for contact lenses A61L12/00 ; atomisers for disinfecting agents A61M ; sterilisation of packages or package contents in association with packaging B65B55/00 ; treatment of water, waste water, sewage or sludge C02F ; disinfecting paper D21H21/36 ; disinfecting devices for water closets E03D ; articles having provision for disinfection, see the relevant subclasses for these articles, e.g. H04R1/12

note.note-paragraph: In each set of groups A61L15/08 to A61L15/12 and A61L15/18 to A61L15/40 , in the absence of an indication to the contrary, classification is made in the last appropriate place.
When classifying in groups A61L15/08 to A61L15/12 , classification is also made in group 15/14 if the use of materials characterised by their function or physical properties is of interest.

When classifying in groups A61L15/18 to A61L15/40 , classification is also made in groups A61L15/42 to A61L15/64 if the use of materials characterised by their function or physical properties is of interest.

title-part.text: containing inorganic materials, e.g. plaster of Paris

note.note-paragraph: In group A61L15/12 and subgroups, the use of specific polymers is indicated using the relevant combination set symbol, adding, after the A61L15/12 symbol, the correspondent symbol of the polymer composition in subclass C08L , e.g. stiffening bandage based on polyurethane A61L15/12 , C08L75/04

title-part.text: Use of materials characterised by their function or physical properties
Bandages, dressings or absorbent pads for physiological fluids such as urine or blood, e.g. sanitary towels, tampons

note.note-paragraph: In groups A61L15/22 to A61L15/30 , the use of specific polymers is indicated using the relevant combination set symbol, adding, after the symbol in A61L , the correspondent symbol of the polymer in subclass C08L , e.g. absorbent pad containing starch A61L15/22 , C08L3/02

characterised by physical conditions of the treatment, e.g. applying a compressive force to the composition, pressure cycles, ultrasonic/sonication or microwave treatment, lyophilisation
characterised by the function or physical properties of the final product, where no specific conditions are defined to achieve this

CPC-specific-text.text: Use of materials characterised by their function or physical properties
Anticoagulant, e.g. heparin, platelet aggregation inhibitor, fibrinolytic agent, other than enzymes, attached to the substrate
using a quaternized group or a protonated amine group of the substrate
using an intermediate layer of polymer
using a polymer with positively charged atoms in the polymeric backbone, e.g. ionenes
characterised by the choice of an antithrombatic agent other than heparin
Porous materials, e.g. foams or sponges
by reacting with an organic compound other than heparin
by grafting of a monomer onto the substrate
Other specific inorganic materials not covered by A61L33/022 or A61L33/025

title-part.text: Use of organic materials, e.g. acetylsalicyclic acid

reference.text: grafting of a monomer onto the substrate A61L33/0088

obtained otherwise than by reactions only involving carbon-to-carbon unsaturated bonds
Other specific proteins or polypeptides not covered by A61L33/122 to A61L33/126

title-part.text: Use of ingredients of undetermined constitution or reaction products thereof
Aspects relating to methods or apparatus for disinfecting or sterilising materials or objects
Apparatus for generating biocidal substances, e.g. vaporisers, UV lamps
Apparatus for isolating biocidal substances from the environment
Sealings, e.g. doors, covers, valves, sluices
Biocide decomposition means, e.g. catalysts, sorbents
Means for controlling sterilisation processes, data processing, presentation and storage means, e.g. sensors, controllers, programs
Biocide distribution means, e.g. nozzles, pumps, manifolds, fans, baffles, sprayers
Mobile applications, e.g. portable devices, trailers, devices mounted on vehicles
Combination with washing or cleaning means
Flexible packaging means, e.g. permeable membranes, paper
Pharmaceuticals, e.g. medicaments, artificial body parts
Containers, e.g. vials, bottles, syringes, mail
Medical instruments, e.g. endoscopes, catheters, sharps
Aspects relating to disinfection, sterilisation or deodorisation of air
Sensor means, e.g. motion, brightness, scent, contaminant sensors
Dispensing or storing means for active compounds
Piezo or ultrasonic elements for dispensing
Distributing means, e.g. baffles, valves, manifolds, nozzles
Supporting means, e.g. stands, hooks, holes for hanging
Use of chemical compounds for treating air or the like
Use of hydrogen peroxide, liquid and vaporous
Use of ozone, e.g. generated by UV radiation or electrical discharge
Use of electrochemically treated water, e.g. electrolysed water or water treated by electrical discharge
Treatment by sorption, e.g. absorption, adsorption, chemisorption, scrubbing, wet cleaning
Biologically active materials used in bandages, wound dressings, absorbent pads or medical devices
Metals or metal compounds, e.g. salts such as bicarbonates, carbonates, oxides, zeolites, silicates
Halogens or compounds thereof, e.g. iodine, chlorite
Peroxy compounds, peroxides, e.g. hydrogen peroxide
with halogen atoms, e.g. triclosan, povidone-iodine
with nitrogen-containing functional groups, e.g. aminoxides, nitriles, guanidines
with other specific functional groups, e.g. aldehydes, ketones, phenols, quaternary phosphonium groups
Lipids, fatty acids, e.g. prostaglandins, oils, fats, waxes
containing metals, e.g. porphyrins, vitamin B12
Glycosaminoglycans, e.g. heparin, hyaluronic acid, chondroitin
Peptides having up to 20 amino acids in a defined sequence
Polypeptides, proteins, e.g. glycoproteins, lipoproteins, cytokines
Genetic materials, DNA, RNA, genes, vectors, e.g. plasmids
Compounds of undetermined constitution extracted from natural sources, e.g. Aloe Vera
characterised by a specific therapeutic activity or mode of action
Tissue-regenerating or healing or proliferative agents
Anti-neoplastic or anti-proliferative or anti-restenosis or anti-angiogenic agents, e.g. paclitaxel, sirolimus
Agents promoting blood coagulation, blood-clotting agents, embolising agents
Immunomodulating agents, i.e. cytokines, interleukins, interferons
Mixtures of two or more drugs, e.g. synergistic mixtures
characterised by a special physical form
Type of release, e.g. controlled, sustained, slow
containing two or more active agents in different layers
Encapsulated active agents, e.g. emulsified droplets
characterised by a special chemical form
Additives, excipients, e.g. cyclodextrins, fatty acids, surfactants
Materials characterised by their function or physical properties
Treatment of implants to prevent calcification or mineralisation in vivo
Methods for forming porous structures using a negative form which is filled and then removed by pyrolysis or dissolution
Nanosized materials, e.g. nanofibres, nanoparticles, nanowires, nanotubes
Materials with shape-memory or superelastic properties
Modification of implant surfaces in order to improve biocompatibility, cell growth, fixation of biomolecules, e.g. plasma treatment
Materials or methods for coatings medical devices
Coatings containing a composite material such as inorganic/organic, i.e. material comprising different phases
Coatings containing a mixture of two or more compounds
Coatings comprising two or more layers
Materials or treatment for tissue regeneration
for reconstruction of tendons or ligaments
for ear reconstruction or ear implants, e.g. implantable hearing aids
for reconstruction of eye parts, e.g. intraocular lens, cornea
for reconstruction of the heart, e.g. heart valves
for reconstruction of hollow organs, e.g. bladder, esophagus, urether, uterus
for embolization or occlusion, e.g. vaso-occlusive compositions or devices
for reconstruction of the spine, vertebrae or intervertebral discs
Preparation and treatment of biological tissue for implantation, e.g. decellularisation, cross-linking
